text:
The struggle was always there – for a pot of water.

The difference this time is that it has intensified a little early.

Getting a pot-full, and storing it have become the primary vocation of women, and even children have to do their bit to keep the kettle boiling.

Fist fights, and wordy duels in front of public taps, and tanker lorries have not become a

major law and order problem, so far. The only happier lot seems to be pot sellers,

and private water suppliers. Officials say that there will not be much decrease

either in quantity or frequency of water supplied.

Of course, they too are pinning their hopes on South West Monsoon.

- Photos: S. Siva Saravanan, and M. Periasamy
title: Water, daily
